snippet: “The Rite of Spring,” Igor Stravinsky’s ballet that celebrates human sacrifice, is widely praised today but was a flop when it was first produced, in Paris in 1913.
abstract: Igor Stravinsky's ballet The Rite of Spring was considered shocking when it premiered in 1913, but now it is simply a well-loved classic.
lead_paragraph: “The Rite of Spring,” Igor Stravinsky’s ballet that celebrates human sacrifice, is widely praised today but was a flop when it was first produced, in Paris in 1913.

headline.seo: ‘Rite of Spring’ Cools Into a Rite of Passage
headline.main: Shocker Cools Into a ‘Rite’ of Passage
headline.print_headline: Shock Me If You Can: Stravinsky’s ‘Rite of Spring’ Once Ignited Passions. Time Has Cooled It Into a Musical Rite of Passage.
